result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Giovanni Zurfluh

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered no contact with LP.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Giovanni Zurfluh appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Giovanni Zurfluh.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is retabbed to Judge Richards, Branch 30 due to lower pending case.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case taken off OCCR calendar. Case to be scheduled in ICCR
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/29/22 @ 1:30p
